name: faas.trigger

members.brief: A response to some data source operation such as a database or filesystem read/write
To provide an answer to an inbound HTTP request
A function is set to be executed when messages are sent to a messaging system
A function is scheduled to be executed regularly
If none of the others apply

brief: Type of the trigger which caused this function invocation.

name: faas.invoked_name
brief: The name of the invoked function.
note: SHOULD be equal to the `faas.name` resource attribute of the invoked function.

name: faas.invoked_provider
brief: The cloud provider of the invoked function.
note: SHOULD be equal to the `cloud.provider` resource attribute of the invoked function.

name: faas.invoked_region
brief: The cloud region of the invoked function.

requirement_level.conditionally_required: For some cloud providers, like AWS or GCP, the region in which a function is hosted is essential to uniquely identify the function and also part of its endpoint. Since it's part of the endpoint being called, the region is always known to clients. In these cases, `faas.invoked_region` MUST be set accordingly. If the region is unknown to the client or not required for identifying the invoked function, setting `faas.invoked_region` is optional.

note: SHOULD be equal to the `cloud.region` resource attribute of the invoked function.
